KeysToMetaData.TipDifficultyEasy: Offers a fun and exciting experience, while also trying to make it more accessible to new Players. This difficulty offers more time when decision making, and will favour spawning weaker versions of enemies.
KeysToMetaData.TipDifficultyNormal: This difficulty gives a rewarding and challenging experience through the levels, but is usually for players more suited with standard First-Person shooter controls.
KeysToMetaData.TipDifficultyHard: A tough experience that requires true HYPERCHARGE heroes to complete. Much more suited for multiple players who can work as a team, share resources and form a build-strategy for each level. It is called Expert for a reason.
KeysToMetaData.TipDifficultyNightmare: Turn back all whom think that this is even fair.
KeysToMetaData.CheatDesc1: Enables DK Mode - Classic large head cheat. Every game is legally required to have this, only some choose to allow it to be enabled by the player.
KeysToMetaData.CheatDesc2: Enables BP Mode - Everything is blue. This seems cool at first, but is also impossible to play.
KeysToMetaData.CheatDesc3:
Enables Low Gravity - Moon gravity time! Watch ragdolls float away with this revolutionary next-gen cheat code.

<Text.Grey>This cheat only works in Singleplayer/Splitscreen!</>
KeysToMetaData.CheatDesc4:
Unlocks all the maps so that they are playable without completing the requirements. 

<Text.Grey>This will need to be re-enabled each time you play.</>
KeysToMetaData.CheatDesc5:
Unlocks the Nightmare Difficulty so you can regret ever trying it.

<Text.Grey>This will need to be re-enabled each time you play.</>
KeysToMetaData.CheatDesc6: Hold your weapon like we did in the good old days and play like a Pro. Combine with grenade-jumping for maximum nostalgia.
KeysToMetaData.CheatDesc7: Enables Lame Aim Down Sights mode. We’re not sure how the toys bend this way... also I’m pretty sure the scopes are made of solid plastic?
KeysToMetaData.CheatDesc8: The year is 1995. You have just opened your new <CHILDHOOD CONSOLE NAME>! It only came with one game called HYPERCHARGE: Unboxed. You will play this game for many hours and somehow never get bored.
KeysToMetaData.CheatDesc9: He is the Sergeant for a reason. Bring in Max Ammo himself to help in the fight again the enemy toys. He's powerful and gets the job done. You can also bring him in for some multilplayer combat. If you dare.
KeysToMetaData.CheatDesc10: Yarr matey' this be given yah the language of the Sea. Change your language to that of a true Pirate.
KeysToMetaData.TextTipInfoComingSoon: <Text.Grey>The map is not yet ready, check back here when the game is updated to play these new maps!</>
KeysToMetaData.UnlockTextAwardAnyLevel: Earn {Award} or above on <Text.Orange>ANY</> level to unlock!
KeysToMetaData.UnlockTextSpecialAllCollectibles: Find all <Text.Purple>Hidden Collectibles</> on all levels!
KeysToMetaData.UnlockTextSpecialCompleteSubAwards: Earn {Award} or above on all levels!
KeysToMetaData.UnlockTextNotInDemo: <Text.Red>This Unlock is not available in the Demo version!</>
KeysToMetaData.UnlockTextMapNotInDemo: <Text.Red>{Map} is not available in the Demo version!</>
KeysToMetaData.UnlockTextNightmare: Unlock {Difficulty} Difficulty by completing all levels on {Award} or above!
KeysToMetaData.UnlockTextAwardAnyMap: Earn {Award} or above, to unlock on that level!
KeysToMetaData.UnlockTextHolidayHalloween: Complete any level during the <Text.Purple>Halloween</> season!
KeysToMetaData.UnlockTextHolidayXmas: Complete any level during the <Text.Purple>Xmas</> season!
KeysToMetaData.UnlockTextCharacterRequired: Unlock the Character <Text.Orange>{Character}</> to use this item.
KeysToMetaData.GameMessagePlagueFlagsEnabled: NEW CAPTURE ZONES ARE NOW ACTIVE!
KeysToMetaData.EndOfRoundDefaultLoseReason: ALL OF YOUR CORES HAVE BEEN LOST
KeysToMetaData.TrapFireDesc: Powerful defensive flame trap to cook your enemies in seconds!
KeysToMetaData.TrapFirePlusDesc: Hottest defensive flame trap on the market. Defend your base using fires from Hell.
KeysToMetaData.TrapGunkDesc: This strange smelling substance will slow down some enemies before they reach their target.
KeysToMetaData.TrapMineDesc: Rigged to explode when enemies are nearby. Only good for one use!
KeysToMetaData.TrapMinePlusDesc: Packed with lots of explosives and rigged to explode when enemies are nearby. Only good for one use!
KeysToMetaData.TrapSpikesDesc: Spikes enemies as they walk over the pressure plate. Powerful and quickly repeating damage.
KeysToMetaData.TrapSpikesPlusDesc: Stabs enemies as they walk over the sensitive pressure plate. Powerful and quickly repeating damage.
KeysToMetaData.TrapVinesDesc: Simple spikey vine trap that has a chance to inflict lasting poison damage to enemies.
KeysToMetaData.TrapVinesPlusDesc: Strong poison vine trap that will inflict lasting poison damage to enemies.
KeysToMetaData.TrapWallDesc: Sturdy defensive blocker that will divert enemy paths or force them to break it down.
KeysToMetaData.TrapWallPlusDesc: Sturdier defensive blocker that will divert enemy paths or force them to break it down.
KeysToMetaData.TurretMachineGunDesc: Small and inaccurate Machine Gun Turret. Useful for defending cores against multiple small and weak enemies.
KeysToMetaData.TurretMachineGunPlusDesc: Twice the length, twice the fire-power. Useful for defending cores against multiple enemies.
KeysToMetaData.TurretMachineGunCannonDesc: Slow and powerful Machine Gun Turret. Useful for small numbers of strong enemies.
KeysToMetaData.TurretRocketDesc: Small single-launcher rocket turret. Useful for taking out multiple small enemies.
KeysToMetaData.TurretRocketPlusDesc: Bigger dual-launcher rocket turret. Useful for taking out large groups enemies.
KeysToMetaData.TurretRocketPlusPlusDesc: Biggest triple-launcher rocket turret. Useful for taking out large groups and powerful enemies.
KeysToMetaData.TurretAntiAirDesc: Keeps your skies clear. A great way to fight back against speedy aircraft.
KeysToMetaData.TurretAntiAirPlusDesc: Keeps your skies clear. The best way to fight against large aircraft or unidentified flying objects.
KeysToMetaData.TurretCannonDesc: Perfect for defending any castle. Fires a stone boulder that can hit multiple enemies in its path.
KeysToMetaData.TurretLaserDesc: This laser was built to help... err
KeysToMetaData.TurretLaserPlusDesc: This surgical laser will deliver damage to any enemy that its dual beams are cast toward.
KeysToMetaData.TurretRadarDesc: This high-altitude EMP turret will deal damage to all nearby enemies within its shockwave radius.
KeysToMetaData.TurretRadarPlusDesc: This very powerful EMP turret will deal massive damage to nearby enemies within its shockwave radius.
KeysToMetaData.TurretSpotLightDesc: Helps visibility in darker environments and increases all damage dealt to enemies in its light beam.
KeysToMetaData.TurretSpotLightPlusDesc: Greatly increases visibility in darker environments and increases all damage dealt to enemies in its light beam.
KeysToMetaData.TurretTurbineDesc: Launches enemies in the direction it is facing. It’s unclear how this is in any way advantageous.
KeysToMetaData.TurretTurbinePlusDesc: Launches multiple enemies in the direction it is facing. A surprisingly good defense if used appropriately.
KeysToMetaData.StatGlue: Some enemies may get completely stuck.
KeysToMetaData.MapTutorialDesc: Sergeant Max Ammo talks you through the basics of the mechanics of HYPERCHARGE.
KeysToMetaData.MapTutorialDescPvP: The gloves are off this time. Fight against other players in the place that your journey began.
KeysToMetaData.MapHallwaySimpleDesc: Welcome to Operation Alley. Learn to defend your HYPERCORE against Meanbots.
KeysToMetaData.MapHallwaySimpleDescPvP: A simple Hallway with not a lot of cover, but the shelves make for a good stronghold. Try to stay in cover!
KeysToMetaData.MapHallwaySimpleDescPL: Not many places to run in this Hallway. Those who climb the highest will survive the longest.
KeysToMetaData.MapKidsBedroomDesc: The enemy is planning to invade our stronghold. Push them back! Watch out for the vents and shelves.
KeysToMetaData.MapKidsBedroomDescPvP: Only scant cover exists in this bedroom, use the Jump Pad’s to your advantage and keep off the ground or you’ll be a sitting duck!
KeysToMetaData.MapKidsBedroomDescPL: Anyone left on the ground will suffer a terrible fate. Hiding is futile in this very open bedroom.
KeysToMetaData.MapBathroomDesc: Flush away your fears. The enemy are coming for our plumbing, stop them immediately! Don’t forget to check the bath.
KeysToMetaData.MapBathroomDescPvP: While it may be the smallest map, you’ll still find yourself fighting for what limited higher ground is available.
KeysToMetaData.MapBathroomDescPL: Nowhere to hide, nowhere to run. Can you quickly climb higher than the infected?
KeysToMetaData.MapToyPalaceDesc: Defend the aisle from the invading toys. Prepare yourselves for a battle on the shelves. And don't forget to keep your eyes on the skies!
KeysToMetaData.MapToyPalaceDescPvP: Trust no one, not even your shelf. Lots of hiding places in the Toy Store, but precious few ways to ascend.
KeysToMetaData.MapToyPalaceDescPL: Hop from shelf to shelf and avoid the plagued toys.
KeysToMetaData.MapActionAtticDesc: Spelunk through the junk and mind the dust. Just keep those HYPERCORES alive!
KeysToMetaData.MapActionAtticDescPvP: Jump, climb, and shoot on this cluttered and dusty battlefield.
KeysToMetaData.MapActionAtticDescPL: Watch for the ominous glow of infected toys in this dimly lit attic. They could be around any corner...
KeysToMetaData.MapAirhockeyShuffleDesc: Welcome to the Arcade, we’ve got fun and games. Also spinners, lots of spinners.
KeysToMetaData.MapKitchenDesc: This battlefield comes preheated. Stay out of the oven!
KeysToMetaData.MapKitchenDescPvP: If you can’t stand the heat, too bad.
KeysToMetaData.MapKitchenDescPL: The cooking isn’t the only biohazard!
KeysToMetaData.MapGarageDesc: Park your defenses in this wide-open combat zone. Climbing may be tricky in this cluttered garage.
KeysToMetaData.MapGarageDescPvP: This garage offers a large combat zone that for both short and long distance combat. Only those skilled enough will be able to lay their hands on the best weapons.
KeysToMetaData.MapGarageDescPL: Don’t let the smell of diesel fuel mask the stench of the infected.
KeysToMetaData.MapHallwayHardDesc: The war over this hallway will be fought from two directions. Grab a flashlight and keep your eyes peeled, this could be tough.
KeysToMetaData.MapHallwayHardDescPvP: This dark hallway offers some varied combat, just got to make sure you can spot the enemy on the move.
KeysToMetaData.MapHallwayHardDescPL: Don’t get cornered in this hallway, there are few places to hide around here... just keep running!
KeysToMetaData.MapGardenDesc: There are reports of dinos in the area. Take care in the tall grass and use the teleporters to cover more ground!
KeysToMetaData.MapGardenDescPvP: The grass offers minimal cover - perfect for an aspiring sniper, ready to creep from bush to bush as they hunt the most dangerous prey in this immense garden.
KeysToMetaData.MapGardenDescPL: Use the huge open space to your advantage, keep ahead of the plague and don’t get cornered. Good luck!
KeysToMetaData.MapShedDesc: The shed is surrounded, watch the roof for enemies dropping in from above and cover the shelves in as many turrets as you can. This is going to be a close one.
KeysToMetaData.MapShedDescPvP: This tiny gauntlet can get really crazy. Playing with any more than 4 players will become a meat-grinder.
KeysToMetaData.MapShedDescPL: Hope that you spawn on the top and with enough ammo to survive. It won’t take long until you’re infected.
KeysToMetaData.MapShedArenaDesc: It seems trouble was wairing outside the shed. Grab what you can and try to survive the gladatorial showdown!
KeysToMetaData.DescPlayer: HYPERCHARGE brand action figure with fully customisable, swappable parts. Defender of the HYPERCORE and destroyer of all who threaten it.
KeysToMetaData.DescBattery: 1.5 volts of alkaline power. These energy cells are vital to the operation of Power Nodes and HYPRECOREs. They can be thrown a great distance, which is an efficient way to insert them into a Power Node quickly.
KeysToMetaData.DescCore: The HYPERCORE is the most important piece of equipment on the battlefield and must be defended at all costs. If the HYPERCOREs are destroyed, the connection toys have with humans will be severed and toys will lose their purpose. At least that's what the instruction manual claims.
KeysToMetaData.DescSlotMachine: Step right up and try your luck! 30 credits to play. Win amazing prizes
KeysToMetaData.DescCharger: Hyper™ brand Hypercharger™ will Hypercharge™ your Hyperbatteries™. Maybe regular batteries too but we haven’t tested it.
KeysToMetaData.DescJumpPad: A useful piece of equipment that propels personnel to new heights. Build Jump Pads on the battlefield to reach elevated positions quickly.
KeysToMetaData.DescPowerNode: Power Nodes connect directly to a HYPERCORE to recharge its shield. Batteries not included.
KeysToMetaData.DescTeleporter: HYPERCHARGE brand equipment that will transmit personnel across the Hypernetwork and rematerialise them at a paired destination unit. Our psychologists recommend that you do not think about the fact that the dematerialisation process will kill you then reconstruct you someplace else. Place a battery in the transmitter unit to operate.
KeysToMetaData.DescJetPack: Equipment that enables personnel to augment their jump. Propulsion lasts just a few seconds before the unit must recharge.
KeysToMetaData.DescCollectible: Collect all of these on the battlefield to unlock additional equipment, body parts, and names.
KeysToMetaData.DescCredits: Thieving Meanbots stole these coins from the HYPERCHARGE vault and scattered them around the battlefield. Collect them to purchase new equipment. Think of it like an allowance that you get to spend on guns.
KeysToMetaData.DescWeaponsAttachments: HYPERCHARGE brand equipment is stored in the boxes we came in. Technically it is still owned by the company so if you want to use it you’ll need to purchase it with credits found on the battlefield.
KeysToMetaData.DescStickerBook: Find and unlock all of the name packs to fill this sticker book! Gotta collect em' all! (Official sticker booklet sold separately)
KeysToMetaData.DescAwards: You will be awarded a medal if you save the HYPERCOREs on the battlefield. The more HYPERCOREs you save the more valuable your medal will be.
KeysToMetaData.DescBatteryHC: A rare, powerful battery that was discontinued after only one year thanks to the propensity for them to occasionally explode. It <Text.Orange>probably</> won't explode in your hands, <Text.Orange>probably</>. The amount of power this battery delivers is vast, as is its carbon footprint.
KeysToMetaData.TipAwards: The enemy wants to meddle with our HYPERCOREs. If you prove your mettle and stop them you will be awarded with a medal made from valuable metal.
KeysToMetaData.StatJumpPadHint: Hint: Batteries can be thrown onto Jump Pads
KeysToMetaData.TipCoreBattery: Tip: Placing batteries in a Power Node will recharge the shield of the HYPERCORE
KeysToMetaData.TipCoreNoDamage: Tip: Keep a HYPERCORE protected by ensuring no damage is taken to its health.
KeysToMetaData.TipBatteryCharged: Tip: Batteries can be thrown into Battery slots for faster insertion.
KeysToMetaData.TipBatteryThrowPad: Tip: Batteries can be thrown onto Jump Pads.
